Step Up to the Streets
programme.desc: Step Up 2: The Streets: Directed by Jon M. Chu. With Briana Evigan, Robert Hoffman, Adam Sevani, Cassie Ventura. Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1023481/","name":"Step Up 2: The Streets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc0NzYxOTgxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgxMjc1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1023481/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GibMart7"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dancing Makes The Movie","reviewBody":"I actually thought that the movie was pretty good. It's not as bad as the reviews that it's getting, just don't go in expecting to get an Oscar performance. The storyline was a little all over the place. Typical teen dance movie. BUT the dancing is amazing couldn't keep my eyes off the screen. Robert Hoffman did a decent job, he really lays the charm in throughout the whole movie. The dance scenes make the entire movie. Ethnically, it is such a diverse cast of people, there is someone for everyone to identify with. The soundtrack is insanely good also. By the end of it you will be quoting lines and wanting to dance for sure.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85707,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Music","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-06-04","keywords":"dance off,dancing in the rain,dance movie,dance audition,dance crew","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Up 2 the Streets","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1253179673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTAyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDMzNjAyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTAyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDMzNjAyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Step Up 2 the Streets Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1382207/","name":"Robert Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0263759/","name":"Briana Evigan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0144260/","name":"Cassie Ventura"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0160840/","name":"Jon M. programme.title: Chicken Run
Chicken Run – Hennen rennen
programme.desc: Chicken Run: Directed by Peter Lord, Nick Park. With Phil Daniels, Lynn Ferguson, Mel Gibson, Tony Haygarth. When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120630/","name":"Chicken Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxNjZlZDYtZGJmZC00Mjg0LWEwYzctYWQ0MWFjNTM3ZmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM5NzI0NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120630/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chrysanthepop"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Chicken Fun","reviewBody":"'Chicken Run' is a delighted little film about...well, chickens. I've always loved the claymation of Aardman. 'Creature Comforts' and 'Wallace and Gromit' are among many of my favorites. Aardman Studios have come up with a brilliant cast, a funny and smart script, fine cinematography and production design. The inspiration of films like 'The Great Escape' shows. The female characters are so strong and yet they have their own sense of humour and Brit-wit. Aardman's claymation is splendid. The large eyes, body size and shape and movements create this a unique class of comedy. The writing is very sharp and crisp but I disliked the obvious symbolism (of British and America joining hands to save the world and fight evil) which looked a little forced. I don't see the need to make the Rocky character an American rooster (as if it's an ingredient to have an American on board). Yet, that does not take away the sheer pleasure and entertainment one derives from the film. The voice cast is suitably chosen. Gibson plays the typical hero with charisma but it's the Brit cast, which includes names like Imelda Staunton, Lynn Ferguson, Jane Horrocks and Julia Sawalha that did it for me. Their sharp witty humour and strong will just put them on a league of their own. 'Chicken Run' is a cute, heartwarming, uplifting and hilarious little film. To quote another user, it is eggcellent!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2000-06-23","keywords":"chicken,farm,escape,rooster,freedom","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chicken Run","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2053636121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk5MjZkNGItMTcwYS00MTVhLTgxNTQtOGY3Mzk1YWNiYTQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk5MjZkNGItMTcwYS00MTVhLTgxNTQtOGY3Mzk1YWNiYTQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0768018/","name":"Julia Sawalha"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200057/","name":"Phil Daniels"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520485/","name":"Peter Lord"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661910/","name":"Nick Park"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103531/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520485/","name":"Peter Lord"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661910/","name":"Nick Park"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456732/","name":"Karey Kirkpatrick"}],"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

Yogi Bär
programme.desc: Yogi Bear: Directed by Eric Brevig. With Dan Aykroyd, Justin Timberlake, Anna Faris, Tom Cavanagh. A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1302067/","name":"Yogi Bear","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI0ZmMwMDYtNTk4OC00NGNhLTk3NDUtNjFmZTI5NTUzYTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1302067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JustAnEpicPerson"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good 3D movie for the kids.","reviewBody":"Yogi Bear is about Jellystone Park about to get closed down because the town is bankrupt. Due to this, Ranger Smith (Tom Cavanagh) throws a party for Jellystone so more visitors come in, more visitors, more money. But Yogi screws it up. So now they must save the park somehow before it gets closed. Yogi (Dan Aykroyd) and Boo Boo (Justin Timberlake) do a good job at voice acting. Tom Cavanagh also does a good job, but everyone else does a bad job. ESPIALLY THE MAYOR (Andrew Daly) HE DOES NOT EVEN TRY. The 3D is pretty good, so if you have a Blu-ray 3D at home, try to rent this movie.\n\nOVERALL: It's funny, great 3D, and pretty good. Go see it, you won't be disappointed."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21370,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-12","keywords":"park,bear,mayor,sabotage,documentary filmmaker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Yogi Bear: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2698381593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5Nzg3NDYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDEyODIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5Nzg3NDYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDEyODIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo, and Ranger Smith."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267506/","name":"Anna Faris"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0108094/","name":"Eric Brevig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0226011/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033149/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893262/","name":"Jennifer Ventimilia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827985/","name":"Joshua Sternin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178589/","name":"Brad Copeland"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Vorstadtkrokodile
Vorstadtkrokodile
programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile: Directed by Christian Ditter. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0803100/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA2NTU0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDY1NDY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0803100/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jannispetersen"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful and moving modern version!","reviewBody":"I didn't know what to expect of the filmatisation of the well-known German novel Vorstadtkrokodile. What I actually can remember is that when I read this novel as a child, I back then thought of, it would be great as a movie. So when I saw this movie is in the cinemas, I had to watch it. And I'm very glad to have done so! First of all the cast is great! Axel Stein does a really great job and also Semmelrogge is very funny in his short scene. I didn't know any of the youngsters, but all of them played their part very well - you instantly buy their roles the way they play them! And then there is the modernization of the context. Enormeausly well-done! Many nice gags, where I laughed out loud! This is a movie for everyone: the youngsters, young adults (like me, I'm in the middle of my twenties) and the elder generation! I hope you have read the novel, but if you haven't, I'm sure you are eager to do, after you watched this fantastic movie.\n\nHeck! I even caught myself gladly smiling at the very end!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-03-26","keywords":"first part,animal in title,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728894/","name":"Martin Ritzenhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902149/","name":"Max von der Grün"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

What I actually can remember is that when I read this novel as a child, I back then thought of, it would be great as a movie. So when I saw this movie is in the cinemas, I had to watch it. And I'm very glad to have done so! First of all the cast is great! Axel Stein does a really great job and also Semmelrogge is very funny in his short scene. I didn't know any of the youngsters, but all of them played their part very well - you instantly buy their roles the way they play them! And then there is the modernization of the context. Enormeausly well-done! Many nice gags, where I laughed out loud! This is a movie for everyone: the youngsters, young adults (like me, I'm in the middle of my twenties) and the elder generation! I hope you have read the novel, but if you haven't, I'm sure you are eager to do, after you watched this fantastic movie.\n\nHeck! programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile 3: Directed by Wolfgang Groos. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1692503/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NTAyNjY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTMwMjA1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1692503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"One last time","reviewBody":"The kids are all grown up ... well they were not when this movie was made. Not entirely at least. Still a little bit older than when they started making them. So part 3 concludes their journey. And is as dramatic as they get. The inciting incident does not seem that big ... but turns out it is .. life an death and all that.\n\nHaving said that, the movie is still overall not riddled with heavy drama, even with that hanging over their heads, there is time for jealousy and other issues one might have growing up. We get our villains back from the first one, but this time around ... well we sort of hope they have grown up too ... not just physically but metaphorically speaking ... I reckon there is not too much mystery or things you'll be surprised will happen in the journey of the movie. Still a neat little movie that is mainly aimed at younger people.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":634,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-20","keywords":"boy in a wheelchair,overalls,stutterer,outtakes during end credits,working mom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0343185/","name":"Wolfgang Groos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0046910/","name":"Thomas Bahmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381074/","name":"Ralf Hertwig"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

The four young snoopers Tim, Karl, Kloesschen and Gaby by chance discover a hidden cave near an old castle. In it there's a board that seems to describe the way to a legendary sword. programme.title: Konferenz der Tiere
Konferenz der Tiere
programme.desc:
Konferenz der Tiere: Directed by Reinhard Klooss, Holger Tappe. With James Corden, Stephen Fry, Andy Serkis, Dawn French. A group of animals waiting for the annual flood they rely on for food and water discover that the humans, who have been destroying their habitats have built a dam for a leisure resort." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1620449/","name":"Konferenz der Tiere","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNjE2Njc1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQ2NTk3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of animals waiting for the annual flood they rely on for food and water discover that the humans, who have been destroying their habitats have built a dam for a leisure resort.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1620449/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"timothycrippins"},"dateCreated":"2011-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pollution in itself","reviewBody":"A film so bad it has forced me to spend time creating an IMDb account to warn others about it.

Animals United should not require a lengthy review or synopsis to achieve this aim. Despite being a feature clearly made for under 12s, the film has a brutal environmental and political agenda of breathtaking ambition. This is presented with so little nuance or charm that, despite all the perfectly good arguments for ecological action, you somehow despise the animals who star.

The plot is paper thin, chaotic and occasionally plain nonsense. For instance, the plot insists environmental conferences achieve nothing but a conference of animals which tails off into a juvenile eulogy for a fantasy world somehow inspires the action required. Not even my three year old niece fell for that level of reasoning.

Worst of all, I watched the entire film and, despite sharing the immediate area of the cinema with around twelve children of various ages, can honestly say they did not even smile once, let alone laugh. It is devoid of any entertainment value. I think you get the point.

I wonder how the makers of this film can live with the amount of energy being wasted to give it distribution...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6383,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2010-10-07","keywords":"father daughter relationship,hero,heroine,fire,rabbit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Animals United","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi162440473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJiYWE5ZTctNjUyZS00YmJjLWExNjktOWRhNTgzMDgwM2RiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJiYWE5ZTctNjUyZS00YmJjLWExNjktOWRhNTgzMDgwM2RiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Animals United"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179479/","name":"James Corden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000410/","name":"Stephen Fry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0785227/","name":"Andy Serkis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0459996/","name":"Reinhard Klooss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1637852/","name":"Holger Tappe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118168/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234654/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380835/","name":"Simon Hauschild"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075038/","name":"Oliver Huzly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0459996/","name":"Reinhard Klooss"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
Gullivers Reisen – Da kommt was Grosses auf uns zu
programme.desc:
Gulliver's Travels: Directed by Rob Letterman. With Jack Black, Jason Segel, Emily Blunt, Amanda Peet. Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320261/","name":"Gulliver's Travels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NTUwOTM3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA3NjIwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CrashRaindog"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"I really wish I could unwatch this film","reviewBody":"As a fan of the original work, which was a satire on the political climate at the time of it's writing, this dire pile of Follywood dross is so far removed from any idea contained within the book it came from that it may as well not be so titled.

Jack Black is beginning to become pretty tiresome in the role he's adopted in most of the films he's appeared in, his appeal is wearing thin. Unless he finds a new direction and follows it, I don't see him being that popular for very much longer, certainly not with people with an IQ greater than their show size at any rate.

I'm appalled that this pathetic attempt at a retelling of a classic tale has been allowed to be passed off as something worth spending money on. In true Hollywood style it is vacuous and totally formulaic to the point that I could predict most of the film. I didn't even bother watching the end as I had better things to do, such as scraping out the oven with my teeth.

I really do wish I could unwatch this terrible film, it didn't even try that hard. The people responsible for this travesty must really think very little of their audience."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-12-29","keywords":"reference to gulliver's travels,reference to gulliver,gulliver,close up of eye,close up of eyes","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gulliver's Travels - Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2625476889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shipwrecked travel writer Lemuel Gulliver (Black) finds himself transported to an island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle, where he's a giant among the natives, the Lilliputians. Initially taken prisoner, Gulliver becomes a favorite of the court and schemes for a way in which the Lilliputians can outwith their rivals, the Blefuscudians."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1289434/","name":"Emily Blunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781981/","name":"Jason Segel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0842605/","name":"Jonathan Swift"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320261/","name":"Gulliver's Travels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NTUwOTM3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA3NjIwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320261/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CrashRaindog","dateCreated":"2011-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"I really wish I could unwatch this film","reviewBody":"As a fan of the original work, which was a satire on the political climate at the time of it's writing, this dire pile of Follywood dross is so far removed from any idea contained within the book it came from that it may as well not be so titled.

Jack Black is beginning to become pretty tiresome in the role he's adopted in most of the films he's appeared in, his appeal is wearing thin. Unless he finds a new direction and follows it, I don't see him being that popular for very much longer, certainly not with people with an IQ greater than their show size at any rate.

I'm appalled that this pathetic attempt at a retelling of a classic tale has been allowed to be passed off as something worth spending money on. In true Hollywood style it is vacuous and totally formulaic to the point that I could predict most of the film. I didn't even bother watching the end as I had better things to do, such as scraping out the oven with my teeth.

I really do wish I could unwatch this terrible film, it didn't even try that hard. The people responsible for this travesty must really think very little of their audience.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-12-29","keywords":"reference to gulliver's travels,reference to gulliver,gulliver,close up of eye,close up of eyes","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gulliver's Travels - Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2625476889","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shipwrecked travel writer Lemuel Gulliver (Black) finds himself transported to an island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle, where he's a giant among the natives, the Lilliputians. programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
Der Kaufhaus Cop 2
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"More of the same","reviewBody":"Although the original "Paul Blart: Mall Cop" was a box office hit, I don't think anyone was exactly clamouring for a sequel. But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Kids (YOUNG kids) might find the humor to be funny, but I think other adults like myself will sit in silence like I did. Is there anything of merit to be found in the movie? Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2263115/","name":"Raini Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895150/","name":"Eduardo Verástegui"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275698/","name":"Andy Fickman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. programme.title: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre
Asterix und Obelix: Mission Kleopatra
programme.desc: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre: Directed by Alain Chabat. With Gérard Depardieu, Christian Clavier, Jamel Debbouze, Monica Bellucci. Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0250223/","name":"Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q3NmUzNjAtM2VjMS00MGU3LWE4YjEtZTM1NDM0YTdlOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0250223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"they're crazy those Romans!","reviewBody":"In 1995, the movie "le hussard sur le toit" was released and it had a record; it was the most expensive movie ever made. This record was beaten seven years later with this film. But once again, this enormous budget was worth to be spending. Alain Chabat controls perfectly the huge incomes to his disposition (for example, sceneries are carefully restored and the crowd movements are wide) and he succeeds in recreating the fanciful atmosphere of the Astérix'albums. His making is very inventive, full of clever visuals and ringing brainwaves. Moreover, he doesn't only emphasize on the special effects of the movie and this was one of the faults of the first Astérix' film made by Claude Zidi in 1999. On the other hand, what a casting! It's very similar to the Sacha Guitry's film "si Versailles m'étais conté" and you can have fun by guessing which actor epitomize which character of the album "Astérix et Cléopâtre". As far as Christian Clavier and Gérard Depardieu are concerned, they're better managed than in the Zidi's film: they don't ham it up and are more credible in their respective roles even if Depardieu isn't fat enough. The other actors are excellent, (especially Gérard Darmon) rightly chosen even the minor actors in whom Chabat grants a big importance. Nevertheless, this one doesn't fit in the Caesar's role: he is a bit listless and not authoritarian enough. At last, let's notice that the characters' names are successful and funny puns (Menubestofplus, Numérobis, Itinéris), but they're only easily understood for French people. At the end, a successful adaptation of the Astérix's comic strip on the screen and a pleasant entertainment."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51219,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2002-01-30","keywords":"architect,based on comic book,egypt,druid,cleopatra","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979890201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000367/","name":"Gérard Depardieu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213354/","name":"Jamel Debbouze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049807/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331453/","name":"René Goscinny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879853/","name":"Albert Uderzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: De l'autre côté du lit
Auf der anderen Seite des Bettes
programme.desc: De l'autre côté du lit: Directed by Pascale Pouzadoux. With Sophie Marceau, Dany Boon, Antoine Duléry, Roland Giraud. To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1275590/","name":"De l'autre côté du lit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGEwNTE3MzUtOWNmOS00N2Q2LWI2MDAtZGNhODI3NDM4N2U3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQzNzQxNzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"To save their marriage, a man and a woman decide to exchange their lives for a year.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1275590/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aleena_m"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Take it for what it is","reviewBody":"Before deciding if I want to see a movie or not, I usually do 2 things: I check out the IMDb vote and I see the trailer. To tell you the truth I did this quite a long time ago for this one, so I looked at the vote again before hitting the play button. You can imagine that my expectations were quite low: a 5.2 out of 10 isn't that much and the 3 reviews out there were so critical. I decided to see it anyway imagining that I will at least have a different experience given that the movies I normally watch are Hollywood productions. I must say I actually enjoyed it! I took it as a comedy, not as a documentary! I saw people were complaining about the fact that the situations were highly unlikely or that the movie was inspired from a book and it didn't do it justice. Well movies rarely succeed in doing that as far as I know... Books and movies are 2 distinct experiences! I liked the fact that there was little or no vulgarity and a complete lack of fart/bodily fluids/coarse sex jokes that I see too often! I don't find those funny! It's way more difficult to make people laugh because of funny circumstances or truly intelligent or sarcastic lines! To wrap it up without giving anything away, take it as a light-hearted comedy and don't have too high expectations - you might actually enjoy it ;)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2594,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2009-01-07","keywords":"role reversal,switched identity,f rated,singing in a car,family relationships","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200702/","name":"Dany Boon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241383/","name":"Antoine Duléry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0233587/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0257823/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3248435/","name":"Alix Girod de l'Ain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693903/","name":"Pascale Pouzadoux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897065/","name":"Grégoire Vigneron"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Duplex
Duplex – Der Appartement-Schreck
programme.desc:
Duplex: Directed by Danny DeVito. With Ben Stiller, Drew Barrymore, Eileen Essell, Harvey Fierstein. A young couple has a chance to move into a gorgeous duplex in the perfect New York neighborhood. All they have to do is bump off the current tenant, a cute little old lady." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0266489/","name":"Duplex","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODAzNmI0MTYtMzZlNi00Yjk5LThhMjItOTFkMDRhNjdhYjUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young couple has a chance to move into a gorgeous duplex in the perfect New York neighborhood. All they have to do is bump off the current tenant, a cute little old lady.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0266489/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Hinksy"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"A pleasant surprise","reviewBody":"Put this on last night not know anything about it and was pleasantly surprised. The plot was interesting and finished with a nice twist. Stiller and Barrymore worked well together and had a good chemistry, and it was a nice surprise to watch a comedy without too many attempts at silly slapstick.

There are very few laugh out loud moments, but I was smiling on a number of occasions. Definitely reminds me of War of the Roses, which is no bad thing, and the leads play it very well.

I liked the ending too, although I would have gone absolutely mental if I was them. Not what I was expecting at all. Anyone expecting the regular Ben Stiller comedy like Dodgeball will be disappointed but if you approach this with an open mind, you should be OK.

Overall, quite good and a well earned 7 out of ten from me.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":57060,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-03-10","keywords":"duplex,dark comedy,manhattan new york city,christmas,slapstick comedy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Duplex","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3840843289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzBkZTQ3ZTgtYWFjMC00MzQzLTgzMGItYzRmZjY3MTc5NTFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzBkZTQ3ZTgtYWFjMC00MzQzLTgzMGItYzRmZjY3MTc5NTFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Duplex"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000106/","name":"Drew Barrymore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1169742/","name":"Eileen Essell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000362/","name":"Danny DeVito"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039303/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148520/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0236421/","name":"Larry Doyle"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Unfinished Business
Big Business – Ausser Spesen nichts gewesen
programme.desc:
Unfinished Business: Directed by Ken Scott. With Vince Vaughn, Tom Wilkinson, Dave Franco, Sienna Miller. A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2358925/","name":"Unfinished Business","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwYjc3ZWEtNjMxNS00MzdkLWEwYWQtYWRkMDUwZWRhMjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every way imaginable, and unimaginable.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2358925/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maclock"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amusing","reviewBody":"Unfinished Business was a welcome surprise. Based on what I had read about it, I was prepared to leave the theatre underwhelmed and disappointed. That did not happen, though.

Vince Vaughn and Tom Wilkinson were amusing in their roles and they seemed to get things more right than wrong when it came to delivery and to timing. The character of their simple sidekick was more than a bit annoying, but it was good to see that the characters played by Vaughn and Wilkinson cut him a lot of slack. In short, this is a better movie than many IMDb amateur reviewers would have you believe. 

I found myself chuckling more than a few times, laughing at their antics and the absurdity of it all. This was a charming and amusing film in the end. If I were to guess, then some of the reviewers here may have felt discomfort over the depictions of drinking, drug use, and sexuality in this picture. So it goes. Recommended viewing for the non-church going set."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33094,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-08","keywords":"male nudity,business trip,company,glory hole,businessman","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415687705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA1MzkxOTAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgyMTg1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hard-working small business owner and his two associates travel to Europe to close the most important deal of their lives. But what began as a routine business trip goes off the rails in every imaginable - and unimaginable - way, including unplanned stops at a massive sex fetish event and a global economic summit.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000681/","name":"Vince Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2002649/","name":"Dave Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0779433/","name":"Ken Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175726/","name":"Steve Conrad"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

Based on what I had read about it, I was prepared to leave the theatre underwhelmed and disappointed. That did not happen, though.

Vince Vaughn and Tom Wilkinson were amusing in their roles and they seemed to get things more right than wrong when it came to delivery and to timing. The character of their simple sidekick was more than a bit annoying, but it was good to see that the characters played by Vaughn and Wilkinson cut him a lot of slack. In short, this is a better movie than many IMDb amateur reviewers would have you believe. 

I found myself chuckling more than a few times, laughing at their antics and the absurdity of it all. This was a charming and amusing film in the end. programme.title: Men in Black
MIB – Men In Black
programme.desc: Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crowrobot"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best sci-fi comedies ever made.","reviewBody":"As my one line summary says, this is one of the best sci-fi comedies ever made, next to the classic Ghostbusters and the highly underrated Evolution. This movie has action, comedy, and some of the best special effects in the last ten years. Rick Baker, Hollywood's resident 'creature man', as I like to call him, has made such a wide variety of aliens. There's the first alien we see, Mikey; there's the Worm Guys; and the villanous Bug. But there are many others, such as Frank the Pug and the twins. The squid baby is pretty neat. Tommy Lee Jones and Will Smith have an undeniable chemistry together, which repeats itself in the sequel. Linda Fiorentino is also good as the leading lady, and veteran actor Rip Torn is gruff as the head of MIB, Zed. Vincent D'Onofrio is also pretty good. My favorite line: "No, ma'am. We at the FBI do not have a sense of humor that we are aware of." All in all, two thumbs up, baby!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":540588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black II
Men in Black 2
programme.desc:
Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott"},"dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. IMDb data; ttnr: 0120912, Title: Men in Black II, --- Description: Men in Black II: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rip Torn, Lara Flynn Boyle. Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120912/","name":"Men in Black II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxNDA0NTMxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDE2NzY2._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Jay is sent to find Agent Kay and restore his memory after the re-appearance of a case from Kay's past.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120912/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Michael_Elliott","dateCreated":"2012-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Sequel About Money","reviewBody":"Men in Black II (2002)

* 1/2 (out of 4) 

Boring and bland sequel has Earth coming under attack from a dangerous alien (Lara Flynn Boyle) so Agent Jay (Will Smith) must bring Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones) out of retirement. I really wasn't sure what to expect out of this sequel but the very, very, very last thing I did expect was something boring. I must admit that I was really shocked to see how bland and downright bad this movie was as sadly it's yet another example of a sequel to a good movie being about nothing more than money. The original film was smart, clever and funny in regards to the subject matter but this sequel just lacks any sort of originality and it's really nothing more than a copy of the original. What's so sad is that there could have been so many good and interesting story ideas but sadly we're just given a copy of the first film and we even get many of the same jokes. It's funny to think that the jokes worked so well the first time but here they're just annoying and unfunny. I think the majority of the blame has to go towards the screenplay, which is just a mess. It's never funny, never makes too much sense and sadly it's clear that very little went into it. The performances outside of Tommy Lee Jones really aren't all that memorable either. Lara Flynn Boyle has no problems looking sexy but her character is bland. Rip Torn isn't given much to do and the same is true for Johnny Knoxville and Rosario Dawson. The incredibly bad love story with Dawson is just an embarrassment. MEN IN BLACK II even features some very poor CGI effects and in the end this is just a rather worthless movie that isn't worth the trouble.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":358920,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-07-24","keywords":"lingerie,michael jackson character,calzone,video conference,leather outfit","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1097638425","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2NDUzMDg5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE0OTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent J needs help so he is sent to find Agent K and restore his memory","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001800/","name":"Rip Torn"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330565/","name":"Robert Gordon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266673/","name":"Barry Fanaro"],"duration":"PT1H28M"</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Mark Wahlberg, Mila Kunis, Joel McHale, Giovanni Ribisi, Aedin Mincks

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
Freunde mit gewissen Vorzügen
programme.desc:
Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165101/","name":"Patricia Clarkson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110404/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226647/","name":"Keith Merryman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226970/","name":"David A. Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Vorwärts immer
Vorwärts Immer
programme.desc:
Vorwärts immer!: Directed by Francis Meletzky. With Jörg Schüttauf, Josefine Preuß, Jacob Matschenz, Hedi Kriegeskotte. Berlin 1989, shortly before the fall of the Wall: While the actor Otto is rehearsing for his role as head of state and party leader Erich Honecker, the regime is fighting for survival. The military and police are preparing to use force to crush the Leipzig Monday demonstration in the evening. To protect his pregnant daughter Anne, who wants to get forged papers for her escape from the republic in Leipzig, of all days, Otto comes up with a daring plan: disguised as Honecker, he wants to withdraw the order to shoot. The opportunity is good because the real head of state is out hunting all day. Others also want to use his absence: Crown Prince Krenz and Stasi chief Mielke, who are secretly preparing a change of power in the Central Committee. The putschists are all the more astonished when they suddenly see Honecker in front of them. Otto plays the role of his life - but unfortunately the unexpected appearance of Margot, the secret ruler of the workers 'and peasants' state, thwarted his plans at the last minute. Meanwhile, the Stasi is on the heels of his daughter and her contact August, who is secretly filming for western television. And Anne has someone else on her cheek: her jealous friend Matti. He wants to dissuade her from her escape plans - and above all to pull away from August." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5307194/","name":"Vorwärts immer!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQyMzlkOTQtNDA0ZS00NWY0LTgxMGMtMWFiYTE1NDYwYmZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQ3NzUxOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Berlin 1989, shortly before the fall of the Wall: While the actor Otto is rehearsing for his role as head of state and party leader Erich Honecker, the regime is fighting for survival. The military and police are preparing to use for","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5307194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sheilabee-52230"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's true. You need to know the era.","reviewBody":"Having said that, if you do know it then it is a ridiculously funny film.

I'm a non-german but with ties to the GDR and I lived in the BRD for years. I'm amazed how they (all involved) carried it off so 'convincingly', the whole sound and feel of the film. I've just watched it again mainly because there wasn't much else on that evening, given covid and all. I'm so glad I did. I'd forgotten quite how silly it is and I really needed a good laugh.

It takes away nothing of the hard and serious times people were going through. It doesn't make a mockery of them. It's target is the party/state centre. I'm aware that I'm repeating most of what another reviewer has already said, but it wants saying again. This film is worth seeing because it's a funny film and because, whilst I understand there are many who might not want to be reminded of the period, we need to remember it. And we may as well be laughing when we do it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-12","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0778335/","name":"Jörg Schüttauf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0559326/","name":"Jacob Matschenz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577641/","name":"Francis Meletzky"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201642/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2550656/","name":"Markus Thebe"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

You need to know the era.","reviewBody":"Having said that, if you do know it then it is a ridiculously funny film.

I'm a non-german but with ties to the GDR and I lived in the BRD for years. I'm amazed how they (all involved) carried it off so 'convincingly', the whole sound and feel of the film. I've just watched it again mainly because there wasn't much else on that evening, given covid and all. I'm so glad I did. I'd forgotten quite how silly it is and I really needed a good laugh.

It takes away nothing of the hard and serious times people were going through. It doesn't make a mockery of them. It's target is the party/state centre. I'm aware that I'm repeating most of what another reviewer has already said, but it wants saying again. This film is worth seeing because it's a funny film and because, whilst I understand there are many who might not want to be reminded of the period, we need to remember it. And we may as well be laughing when we do it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5,"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-10-12","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0778335/","name":"Jörg Schüttauf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0559326/","name":"Jacob Matschenz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0577641/","name":"Francis Meletzky"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061958/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201642/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076073/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2550656/","name":"Markus Thebe"],"duration":"PT1H34M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nine Lives
Nine Lives
programme.desc: Nine Lives: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Garner, Robbie Amell, Cheryl Hines. A stuffy businessman finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4383594/","name":"Nine Lives","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzEzMjkwMjc3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzc0NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stuffy businessman finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4383594/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mnemon07"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"its not as bad as people say","reviewBody":"I've read some awful reviews about this movie and my expectations were set low. I was expecting to be dragged by my kids to a mix of "Baby Geniuses 2" and "Battlefield Earth". But I was pleasantly surprised. This movie won't win any Oscars, but its a reasonable kids movie. Kids liked it, and I was OK with it. Yes, the plot is predictable, and the jokes are pretty flat, but they are geared toward 10 year olds and adults who really like cats, and that is what is expected from a kids movie about a cat. If you hate cats, well, don't see it, see "Shaggy Dog" instead, its virtually the same plot, except its a different type of a pet. I think this movie is OK and I look forward to seeing new incarnations of the same plot in the future movies, such as "Being Goldie" (hint, hint movie studio, in about 10 years we will be ready for another one of those plots)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22082,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2016-08-03","keywords":"cat,skyscraper,husband wife relationship,body swap,business","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1764930585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ2MjI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTg0NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ2MjI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTg0NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Stuffy businessman Tom Brand (Kevin Spacey) finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat. If any hope exists of returning to his family as the husband and father they deserve, Tom will have to learn why he has been placed in this peculiar situation and the great lengths he must go to earn back his human existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000228/","name":"Kevin Spacey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004950/","name":"Jennifer Garner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2064412/","name":"Robbie Amell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0269133/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527095/","name":"Gwyn Lurie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020820/","name":"Matt Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933128/","name":"Caleb Wilson"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="
